allow:
Bash(Zusätzlich benötigt man..."

The old regex was greedy and captured everything between
first { and last }, including text after the JSON.

Solution:
1. Non-greedy JSON extraction using brace/bracket counting
   - Tracks opening/closing braces while respecting strings
   - Stops at first complete JSON block
   - Ignores all text after the JSON

2. Improved prompt clarity:
   - "ABSOLUT NUR JSON" \(no introductions\)
   - "KEIN Text nach dem JSON"
   - Lists forbidden patterns: "Hier ist...", "Der API Call..."

This prevents "Unexpected non-whitespace character after JSON"
errors when DeepSeek adds explanations after the JSON.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")
